instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Hi ive got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 that is running extremly slow, ive run the diagnostics and no errors apart from complaining about battery which im guessing because its not an original, anybody got any glues where to start looking, ive already had a good look at the board and theres no signs of water damage at all

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Try another battery, also be prepared to get it back soon for a dead GPU...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Which battery error? The not sealed/unsealed error can be ignored.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Hi thanks for the questions, error message is  4xxx/4/40000005: "battery" tried to google it but nothing came back , i tried it without battery installed and still runs slow, i mean painfully slow :-)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Please run the real EFI ASD and not the built in garbage.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Hi Duke as far as i can make out i need version 3S144 but i cant seam to find it anywhere , is there another version i can run ? , sorry if i sound a bit thick :-) but im new to this

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: No, there is a torrent out there with all ASDs, something like 60GB total. Google is your friend here.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Hi Duke finally got asd 3s144, ran it in efi mode 6 times with no errors reported so then ran in os mode and it did come up with error 28 mux switching failed- didnt switch error and also error 255 unkown result - code 0xff , im guessing could that mean the graphics chip is on the way out ??

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: Try a known good ORIGINAL battery, can even be from a 13" for testing.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: hi , eventually got a good battery and error 255 has gone but error 28 mux switching failed- didnt switch error is still there , would this be down to the graphics chip about to fail ???

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
threads.message: It will be a bad GPU or MUX. GPU should be replaced as it will be dead soon anyway. Good luck finding chips....

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> early 2011 running extremly slow
